appendix.title: Accessing the Source or Debug repositories
appendix.para: Mirroring the Source or Debug repositories and enabling them on your system is documented as part of and .
However, if your &rhla; or CentOS Linux system is already registered with the &rmt; server and you just need to enable individual repositories, this section highlights the relevant steps.

listitem.para: The &rmt; server is installed and up to date.
The &productname; &productnumber; LTSS product is enabled on the &rmt; server.
Your &rhla; or CentOS Linux system is registered with the &rmt; server.

appendix.para: Repositories must be mirrored on the &rmt; server before you can access them on your &rhla; or CentOS Linux system. &ha;, BASE, Source and Debug repositories are not mirrored by default. Use this procedure to mirror any additional repositories you need:

procedure.title: Mirroring additional repositories on the &rmt; server

listitem.para: BASE repositories are frozen and contain the existing packages from the non-LTSS repositories.
LTSS repositories contain new packages for &productname; &productnumber; LTSS.
LH repositories are the &ha; repositories for &productname; &productnumber; LTSS.

step.para: If the repositories you need already have the status Mirror, skip this procedure and go to .
Enable a repository using its four-digit repository ID. You can enable multiple repositories at once:
Start package mirroring for the enabled repositories:
This will take some time to complete.

appendix.para: After the repositories finish mirroring, use this procedure to enable them on your &rhla; or CentOS Linux system:

procedure.title: Enabling additional repositories on &rhla; or CentOS Linux

step.para: Be aware that all &productname; &productnumber; LTSS repositories are listed and can be enabled even if they are not mirrored on the &rmt; server. However, you can only download content from a repository if it is mirrored on the &rmt; server.
Enable the repositories you need using their repo id. You can enable multiple repositories at once:
Run the update command to make sure there are no errors:
If you enabled a repository that is not mirrored on the &rmt; server, you will see a 404 error.
